description:
* Based on http://anidb.net/cr1507 [Kakifly]`s seinen 4-koma manga series K-ON!, serialised in Manga Time Kirara since 2007.
It is the final year of high school for http://anidb.net/ch4424 [Hirasawa Yui] (guitar), http://anidb.net/ch4426 [Tainaka Ritsu] (drums), http://anidb.net/ch4425 [Akiyama Mio] (bass), and http://anidb.net/ch4427 [Kotobuki Tsumugi] (keyboard); the founding members of the Light Music Club. Together with their junior member http://anidb.net/ch7124 [Nakano Azusa] (guitar), they spend their days after school in the music room enjoying tea and sweets, and practising music. Amidst band practice, preparations for the new student orientation performance, scouting for new members, and student responsibilities they still have time for After School Tea Time.
Source: ANN

REGULAR.description: Yui Hirasawa, Mio Akiyama, Ritsu Tainaka, and Tsumugi Kotobuki from the Light Music Club enter their third and final year of high school. It`s recruiting season again, and the members set off to find new members along with second-year Azusa Nakano, who joined after the previous year`s new student welcome ceremony.

The Light Music Club decides to clean up the disorganized Music Preparation Room. The room has become a storage space for miscellaneous items, mostly stuff that Yui collected from who knows where, as well as other personal belongings.

The Light Music Club is captivated by Ton-chan, their newest member (?).
It`s another normal day for the club when Ritsu suddenly kicks up a fuss after viewing something on a laptop. Having seen photos from the club activity records, Ritsu realizes that she doesn`t stand out enough.

The Sakuragaoka High School seniors set off for a field trip to Kyoto. Since the students must go around in groups of at least four, the Light Music Club members form their own group, but Yui and Ritsu are already so hyped up on riding the bullet train there that Mio is filled with trepidation.

Yui sends Ui and Azusa photos of all the fun she`s having on her field trip.
With the seniors gone, Azusa and Jun try to cheer up Ui, who misses her beloved sister, and school feels a little different.

It`s the rainy season, and it`s been raining all morning. Yui tries to get to school without getting Geeta wet, but has a tough time on the way. Yui arrives at the classroom soaked, and is the center of everyone`s attention.

As they walk down the hall, Yui notices that Mio is acting strange. When asked, Mio replies that she thinks someone has been watching her all morning.
With the exception of a concerned Azusa, the Light Music Club members all poke fun at Mio for being a scaredy-cat.

Nodoka is surprised that Yui still hasn`t figured out her plans for after high school.
Ritsu also writes "undecided" on her life plans questionnaire and Sawako summons the two girls to the staff room.
Worried about the two of them, Nodoka and Mio share some childhood memories with Tsumugi.

Finals are coming up, and the Light Music Club seniors aren`t in their usual music room, spending their time after school studying in the library instead.
Unlike Mio and Tsumugi who buckle down to study, Yui and Ritsu have trouble concentrating as usual.

On her way to school one morning, Tsumugi happens to see Sawako having a nervous conversation with someone in a car. What`s more, Sawako receives a suspicious phone call after school in the music room, and the Light Music Club members decide to investigate.

The Light Music Club practices on a hot summer day, but the sweltering heat is affecting their concentration. The members try all sorts of things to cool down, but finally turn to their advisor Sawako for suggestions.

Sakuragaoka High School has entered summer break. This will be the last summer break for the seniors, and Yui suggests that they have a training camp.
Although hesitant at first, Mio decides to organize a camp when talk of a summer music festival pops up.

Yui and the other senior Light Music Club members study in the library in preparation for university entrance exams. Being the only second-year, Azusa is at home with a lot of time on her hands. Just as Azusa is thinking she wants to make the most of summer break, Ui comes to visit.

After the ever-studious Mio refuses to hang out with her, Ritsu is alone near the station when she spots Tsumugi, who is out planning to buy some summer prep course materials. Ritsu then asks Tsumugi to hang out with her.

Summer break is over, the second term has begun, and with the school festival just around the corner Azusa can`t contain her excitement. However, Yui is feeling down about the upcoming school-wide marathon. The girls each do what they can to prepare for the run.

Azusa`s classmate Jun asks about the Light Music Club`s daily activities, and Azusa suddenly realizes that she`s grown accustomed to the seniors` lax attitude. She tries to motivate herself, hoping to restore the discipline she had when she first joined the club.

Because of a water leak from the ceiling in the room directly below, the Light Music Club`s club room is out of commission. With less than a month until the school festival, the members go hunting for another practice venue.

All the Light Music Club seniors are going to be in a production of "Romeo and Juliet" as part of the Class 3-2 presentation for the school festival. The class votes to have Mio play Romeo and Ritsu play Juliet. Practice begins that very day after school, but things
don`t seem to be working out.

It`s the first day of the school festival and there is a flurry of activity at Sakuragaoka High School. Class 3-2 is working hard to prepare for their class play, "Romeo and Juliet." Finally, the show opens to a big crowd.

It`s the second day of the school festival, and the students start preparing early in the morning. Yui and the others are pumped up trom a practice session the night before. At long last, After-school Teatime starts their school festival performance on the auditorium stage.

It`s almost graduation photo time and Yui tries all kinds of hairstyles, unable to decide on a look. The following day during Light Music Club activities, the members try taking practice individual shots.

Yui and the other seniors are facing entrance exams soon, and spend their days studying in the clubroom. Being the only second-year, Azusa hatches a secret plan to give them all chocolates for Valentine`s Day, something she`s never done before.

Yui and the other seniors have no more classes, and decide to all come in the morning to hang out in the clubroom. Everything is laid back as usual when they start talking about unfinished business they might have before graduation.

At long last, it`s graduation day for the four seniors in the Light Music Club. They all decide to meet up and go to school together for their big day, but when the time comes Yui is nowhere to be seen. Ritsu texts Yui`s phone, and gets a hasty response...

SPECIAL.description: Azusa randomly stumbles upon last year`s new student recruitment video, made by Yui and the other seniors. Mio had been so embarrassed by the video that she had hidden it away in a cookie tin. Azusa is then inspired to make a recruitment video of her own.

The seniors are done with classes, but still come to school to hang out in the club room over tea.
Yui is strangely restless, stating that something "very important" is going to be delivered. Then, Nodoka visits the club room.

Yui receives a gift Tsumugi got for her during an overseas trip and wishes she could go somewhere, too. This gets the girls talking, and the Light Music Club decides to go on a graduation trip once entrance exams are over. The five of them including Azusa discuss where they might want to go.
